column9: Large water park, great for the summer if you live near Concord. There are pools, slides and 8 different rides. Most rides require a height limit of 48 inches. Two separate waterplay playgrounds for the under 48 inches crowd. Consider a seaonal pass to get more value.

The place is small and contains only 7 rides, but it's perfect for little kids, and you don't need to walk far to go to other rides. There is no entrance fee, you buy the tickets for the rides and parking is free.

This park offers over 40 rides and exhibitions in a beautiful garden setting. Many unique fruit and vegetable themed rides for small and bigger kids plus a roller coaster, railroads, and boat ride. Exhibits include a collection of world famous Circus Trees, a rock maze, and the Learning Sheds as well as a six majestic gardens
throughout the park. For the young at heart don’t miss the Oak Park playground.
With close to 40 storybook sets, kid-size rides, 15 domestic friendly animals, and 10 acres of gardens, the park is especially designed for kids under eight.

A small amusement park good for toddlers and preschoolers. There is a boat converted to a play structure, train ride, steam boat play, a carousel, a fort, a balloon ride, a Humphrey the Whale ride, playgrounds, an insect barn, as well as a butterfly terrarium.
The Musée Mécanique is an interesting place if you enjoy seeing the games through the years. It contains over 300 operating coin operated mechanical machines and arcade machines.

Great America provides a great choice for family fun and adventure! There is something for everyone. From the many rides and attractions to a water park or even a planet snoopy for the young at heart.  Don’t miss the live entertainment and the daily special events. Be minded for the long lines on the popular rides.

The Boardwalk combines the attraction of the California beach with the thrills of an amusement park. It  offers kiddie and family rids as well as many attractions such as a mini golf and a boardwalk bowl.

Enjoy a fun day with the family at this 135 acres theme park. The park has diverse rides from pulse-pounding roller coasters to gentler options for tots. Their animal program offers unique opportunities to meet animals truly up-close and personal. In addition to the most thrilling rides you'll find a wide variety of top-shelf entertainment and fresh prepared to order and ready to thrill your taste buds.

Small but well planned water park with slides, a river to inner tube around, lap pool and splash area. Separate areas for toddlers, preschoolers and older kids. The 4 large slides at Fortress of Fun have a 48 inch height requirement and the smaller slides in Bucket Bay have a 36 inch height requirement. Open weekends beginning May 24th, daily beginning June 13th – August 24th, and again for weekends only August 30th - September 28th.

Raging Waters is the largest water park in Northern California with high speed slides, wave pool, tubing and pirated themed water play structure. There are two separate play areas for the little kids. Can get very busy on hot days. Open weekends beginning May 9th, daily beginning June 3rd – August 12th, and again for weekends only August 15th - September 13th. Check opening times on website.

32,000 square foot indoor water park with a combination of large slides, spa, open lap pool and a children’s activity pool. The activity pool has zero depth entry and a water play structure. Guests have to be over 48" to ride the 2 water slides. Best to go early as it can get overcrowded. Check opening times on website.

column2: Aquatics Complex at Allan Witt Park
column9: Nice park with two playgrounds. What's about this park is the aquatic center. It has a zero-depth entry play area, a lazy river current for fun, a water slide and diving board. A separate outside shallow play area for kids including slides, climbing structures, water dumping toys and water spray toys adjacent to a grass area for families. There are two 30-foot giant pool slides to keep both kids and adults entertained.
